text: hello everyone today I'm going to give
you an overview of a new Amazon
inspector feature which allows you to
search its vulnerability intelligence
database to find more information about
vulnerabilities covered by inspectors
scanning engine but before we dive
deeper on this new feature let's talk a
little bit about Amazon inspector in
general
Amazon inspector is a vulnerability
Management Service that continuously
scans AWS workloads for software
vulnerabilities and unintended Network
exposure across your entire AWS
organization
once activated Amazon inspector
automatically discovers all of your ec2
instances
container images in ECR and AWS lamina
functions at scale and continuously
monitors them for known vulnerabilities
giving you a Consolidated view of
vulnerabilities across your compute
environment Amazon inspector also
provides a highly contextualized
vulnerability risk score by correlating
vulnerability information with
environmental factors such as external
network accessibility to help you
prioritize the highest risk to address
with the expanded capability to search
for cves related to Linux and container
images using inspector you can retrieve
the details for any vulnerability stored
in inspectors vulnerability database and
covered by inspector scanning engine by
simply providing a common vulnerability
and enumerations
ID or cve for example in this demo we're
going to use the ID cv-2021-44228
this allows customers to confirm the
cves covered by inspector scanning
engine and do preliminary research on
cve you can access the search
capabilities using both the inspector
console and apis note that an Amazon
inspector also includes additional
details for each finding such as which
versions a cve is fixed in and
Remediation instructions
now let's take a look at how you can use
the AWS Management console to view
Amazon inspector and search inspectors
vulnerability database for more
information about the relevant CBE
now that we're in the AWS Management
console we'll go to Amazon inspector
we'll look for inspector in the top of
the search box
and we'll click on Amazon inspector
now that we're in the Amazon inspector
console we'll go to vulnerability
database search on the left side of the
screen
click on that link I've already copied
over the cve we've referenced earlier so
I'm going to paste that into the search
box and click search
and now that we can see the details
associated with this cve we can see the
severity
the CVSs score
the epss score which is the
exploit prediction scoring system score
we can see when this was created by the
vendor the last time it was updated
and then we can also see other great
information around vulnerability
intelligence for example we can see
references to miter attack tactics
techniques and procedures that are
associated with the vulnerability and we
can also see recommended actions by the
cyber security infrastructure and
Security Agency or sisa for short
we can also see references to articles
that are associated with this CV
directly from the console and with that
we can see
all the information associated with a
given CV that Amazon inspector is
checking for
and that's it I've demonstrated how you
can use Amazon inspector to discover
more information about the
vulnerabilities by searching inspectors
vulnerability database
thanks for your time and if you're
interested in learning more please visit
aws.amazon.com forward slash inspector
